backprop(Example, double) - Method in class nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
AIMA Fig 18.14 body of loop after propagating inputs forward: (2) Computing the error vector delta (3) ``Propagating deltas backward from output layer to input layer'' (4) ``Update every weight in network using deltas''

G

gain(Variable, Set<Example>) - Method in class dt.core.AbstractDecisionTreeLearner
For set of examples T, attribute (variable) a with values vk, and Ek = subset of T for which a=vk: IG(T,a) = H(T) - \sum_vk { |Ek|/|T| * H(Ek) } This is the general case of the Boolean version done in AIMA.
gain_boolean(Variable, Variable, Set<Example>) - Method in class dt.core.AbstractDecisionTreeLearner
Return the ``information gain from an attribute test on A,'' which is ``the expected reduction in entropy.'' (AIMA p704)

train(List<Example>, int, double) - Method in class nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
AIMA BACK-PROP-LEARNING algorithm (Fig 18.24).
train(Example, double) - Method in class nn.core.MultiLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
AIMA Fig 18.14 body of loop looks like three steps, but it's really four: (1) ``Propagate the inputs forward to compute the outputs'' (2) Computing the error vector delta (3) ``Propagating deltas backward from output layer to input layer'' (4) ``Update every weight in network using deltas''
train(NeuralNetwork, List<Example>) - Method in interface nn.core.NeuralNetwork.Trainer
